alert.note: Alert for Custer (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 12 at 12:28PM CDT until May 12 at 1:30PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... ...REPLACES FLOOD ADVISORY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Nebraska, including the following county, Custer. * WHEN...Until 530 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1228 PM CDT, Emergency management reported water over Highway 2 near Anselmo. Heavy rain will continue in the warned area due to thunderstorms for the next 2 hours. Flooding is already occurring. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Broken Bow, Sargent, Merna, Anselmo, Comstock, Berwyn, Victoria Springs State Recreation Area, Weissert, Westerville, Lillian, Gates, Walworth, Round Valley, Divide Hill, Pleasant Hill, Wescott, Big Oak Canyon and Arcadia Diversion Dam State Wildlife Management Area. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
